name: metre
description: SI base unit of length

name: kilogram
description: SI base unit of mass

name: second
description: SI base unit of time

name: ampere
description: SI base unit of electric current

name: kelvin
description: SI base unit of thermodynamic temperature

name: mole
description: SI base unit of amount of substance

name: candela
description: SI base unit of luminous intensity

name: radian
description: SI derived unit of plane angle, SI base unit equivalent: 1

name: steradian
description: SI derived unit of solid angle, SI base unit equivalent: 1

name: hertz
description: SI derived unit of frequency, SI base unit equivalent: s-1

name: newton
description: SI derived unit of force, weight, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m.s-2

name: pascal
description: SI derived unit of pressure, stress, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m-1.s-2

name: joule
description: SI derived unit of energy, work, heat, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-2

name: watt
description: SI derived unit of power, radiant flux, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-3

name: coulomb
description: SI derived unit of electric charge, SI base unit equivalent: s.A

name: volt
description: SI derived unit of voltage, electrical potential difference, electromotive force, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-3.A-1

name: farad
description: SI derived unit of electrical capacitance, SI base unit equivalent: kg-1.m-2.s4.A2

name: ohm
description: SI derived unit of electrical resistance, impedance, reactance, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-3.A-2

name: siemens
description: SI derived unit of electrical conductance, SI base unit equivalent: kg-1.m-2.s3.A2

name: weber
description: SI derived unit of magnetic flux, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-2.A-1

name: tesla
description: SI derived unit of magnetic induction, magnetic flux density, SI base unit equivalent: kg.s-2.A-1

name: henry
description: SI derived unit of electrical inductance, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m2.s-2⋅A-2

name: lumen
description: SI derived unit of luminous flux, SI base unit equivalent: cd

name: lux
description: SI derived unit of illuminance, SI base unit equivalent: cd.m-2

name: becquerel
description: SI derived unit of radioactivity, SI base unit equivalent: s-1

name: gray
description: SI derived unit of absorbed dose (of ionizing radiation), SI base unit equivalent: m2.s-2

name: sievert
description: SI derived unit of equivalent dose (of ionizing radiation), SI base unit equivalent: m2.s-2

name: degree (angle)
description: Unit of plane or phase angle, accepted for use with SI: 1 deg = (pi/180) rad

name: minute (angle)
description: Unit of plane or phase angle, accepted for use with SI: 1 ' = (pi/10800) rad

name: second (angle)
description: Unit of plane or phase angle, accepted for use with SI: 1 '' = (pi/648000) rad

name: litre
description: SI derived unit of volume, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m3

name: minute (time)
description: Unit of time, accepted for use with SI: 1 min = 60 s

name: hour
description: Unit of time, accepted for use with SI: 1 h = 3600 s

name: day
description: Unit of time, accepted for use with SI: 1 d = 86400 s

name: tonne
description: Unit of mass,  accepted for use with SI: 1 t = 1000 kg

name: electron volt
description: Unit of energy, accepted for use with SI: 1eV = 1.60218 x 1E-19 J, approximately

name: unified atomic mass unit
description: Physical constant u or Da (Dalton), unit of mass

name: astronomical unit
description: Unit of length,  accepted for use with SI: 1 au = 149597870700 m, roughly the distance from Earth to the Sun

name: parsec
description: Astronomical unit of length, distance, 1 pc = 3.0857E16 m, approximately

name: nautical mile
description: Unit of Length, accepted for use with SI: 1 nmi = 1852 m

name: knot
description: Unit of speed, accepted for use with SI: 1 kt = 1 nmi/h = (1852/3600) m.s-1

name: decibel
description: Unit of sound intensity, accepted for use with SI

name: hectare
description: Unit of area, accepted for use with SI: 1 ha = 10000 m2

name: week
description: Conventional unit of time, equivalent to 604800 s

name: year
description: Unit of time, equivalent to 31536000 s

name: per cent (%)
description: Dimensionless number, expressed as a fraction of 100

name: parts per thousand
description: Dimensionless number, expressed as a fraction of 1000

name: eights of sky covered by cloud
description: Unit of cloud amount, expressed as number of eighths of the sky dome that is covered by clouds

name: degree (angle) per second
description: Unit of angular speed, accepted for use with SI

name: degree Celsius (°C)
description: SI derived unit of temperature, SI base unit equivalent: K

name: degree Celsius per metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of temperature per metre. SI base unit equivalent: K.m-1

name: degree Celsius per 100 metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of temperature per 100 metre, SI base unit equivalent: 0.01 K.m-1

name: Dobson Unit
description: Unit of column abundance of ozone in the atmosphere. One Dobson unit is equivalent of 2.69E16 molecules of ozone per square centimeter. Alternatively, 1 Dobson unit corresponds to a layer of ozone 1E-5 m thick, if the ozone were held at standard temperature and pressure (273 K, 1 atm pressure). [https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Dobson_unit]

name: month
description: Conventional unit of time duration of between 28-31 days whereby 12 months amount to one year

name: per second squared
description: SI derived unit of second order time derivative

name: knot per 1000 metre
description: Unit of spatial gradient of speed, accepted for use with SI, 1 kt.km-1 = 1852/3600000 s-1

name: foot
description: Imperial/US unit of length, equal to 0.3048 metres approximately

name: inch
description: Imperial/US unit of length, equal to 25.4 millimetres

name: decipascal per second (microbar per second)
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of pressure, pressure tendency, SI base unit equivalent: 0.1 kg.m-1.s-3

name: centibar per second
description: Unit of time derivative of pressure, pressure tendency, accepted for use with SI, 1 cb.s-1 = 1000 Pa.s-1

name: centibar per 12 hours
description: Unit of time derivative of pressure, pressure tendency, accepted for use with SI, 1 cb.(12h)-1 = 10/432 Pa.s-1

name: dekapascal
description: SI derived unit of pressure, stress, SI base unit equivalent: 10 kg.m-1.s-2

name: hectopascal
description: SI derived unit of pressure, stress, SI base unit equivalent: 100 kg.m-1.s-2

name: hectopascal per second
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of pressure, SI base unit equivalent: 100 kg.m-1.s-3

name: hectopascal per hour
description: SI derived Unit of time derivative of pressure, SI base unit equivalent: 1/36 kg.m-1.s-3

name: hectopascal per 3 hour
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of pressure, SI base unit equivalent: 1/108 kg.m-1.s-3

name: nanobar
description: Unit of pressure, accepted for use with the SI, 1 nbar = 1E-4 Pa

name: gram per kilogram
description: SI derived unit of mass fraction, dimensionless, SI base unit equivalent:  0.001

name: gram per kilogram per second
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of mass fraction, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 s-1

name: kilogram per kilogram
description: SI derived unit of mass fraction, SI base unit equivalent:1

name: kilogram per kilogram per second
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of mass fraction, SI base unit equivalent: s-1

name: kilogram per square metre
description: SI derived unit of area density

name: standard acceleration due to gravity
description: g0 = 9.80665 m.s-2, approximately

name: geopotential metre
description: The height of a given point in the atmosphere in units proportional to the potential energy of unit mass (geopotential) at this height relative to sea level. (AMS Glossary of Meteorology)

name: millimetre
description: SI derived unit of length, SI base unit equivalent:  0.001 m

name: millimetre per second
description: SI derived unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m.s-1

name: millimetre per hour
description: SI derived unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent: 1/3.6E6 m.s-1

name: millimetre to the sixth power per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of quantity with dimension of L3, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-9 m3

name: centimetre
description: SI derived unit of length, SI base unit equivalent: 0.01 m

name: centimetre per second
description: SI derived Unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent:  0.01 m.s-1

name: centimetre per hour
description: SI derived unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent: 1/360000 m.s-1

name: decimetre
description: SI derived Unit of length, SI base unit equivalent:  0.1 m

name: metre per second
description: SI derived unit of speed

name: metre per second per metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of speed, SI base unit equivalent: s-1

name: metre per second per 1000 metres
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of speed, SI base unit equivalent:  0.001 s-1

name: square metre
description: SI derived unit of area

name: square metre per second
description: SI derived unit of kinematic viscosity, thermal diffusivity, diffusion coefficient

name: kilometre
description: SI derived unit of length, SI base unit equivalent: 1000 m

name: kilometre per hour
description: SI derived unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent:  1000/3600 m.s-1

name: kilometre per day
description: SI derived unit of speed, SI base unit equivalent:  1000/86400 m.s-1

name: per metre
description: SI derived unit of quantity with dimension of reciprocal length, e.g., wave number, optical power, curvature, spatial frequency

name: becquerel per litre
description: Unit of radioactivity concentration, SI base unit equivalent:  0.001 s-1.m-3

name: becquerel per square metre
description: SI derived unit of radioactivity area concentration, SI base unit equivalent: s-1.m-2

name: becquerel per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of radioactivity concentration, SI base unit equivalent: s-1.m-3

name: millisievert
description: SI derived unit of equivalent dose (of ionizing radiation), SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m2.s-2

name: metre per second squared
description: SI derived unit of acceleration

name: square metre second
description: SI derived unit of sea surface wave variance spectral density

name: square metre per square second
description: SI derived quantity with dimension of squared speed

name: square metre second per radian
description: SI derived unit of sea surface wave directional variance spectral density, SI base unit equivalent: m2.s

name: cubic metres
description: SI derived unit of volume

name: cubic metre per second
description: SI derived unit of volume flow rate or time derivative of volume

name: cubic metre per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of volume fraction, SI base unit equivalent: 1

name: metre to the fourth power
description: SI derived unit of the second moment of area, area moment of inertia

name: metre to the two thirds power per second
description: SI derived unit of the quantity with dimension of L^(2/3) T-1

name: kilogram per metre
description: SI derived unit of linear mass density or quantity with dimension of M L-1

name: kilogram per square metre per second
description: SI derived unit of time derivative of mass area density

name: kilogram per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of density, mass density

name: per square kilogram per second
description: SI derived unit of quantity with dimension of M-2.T-1

name: second per metre
description: SI derived unit of quantity with dimension of T. L-1

name: kelvin metre per second
description: SI derived unit of covariance of wind speed and temperature or the product of wind speed and temperature

name: kelvin per metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of temperature

name: kelvin square metre per kilogram per second
description: SI derived unit of potential vorticity

name: mole per mole
description: SI derived unit of mole fraction, SI base unit equivalent: 1

name: radian per metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of plane angle, SI base unit equivalent: m-2

name: newton per square metre
description: SI derived Unit of pressure or equivalent quantity, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m-1.s-2

name: pascal per second
description: SI derived Unit of temopral derivative of pressure, SI base unit equivalent: kg.m-1.s-3

name: kilopascal
description: SI derived unit of pressure, stress, equal to 1000 Pa, SI base unit equivalent: 1000 kg.m-1.s-2

name: joule per square metre
description: SI derived unit of radiant exposure, SI base unit equivalent: m2.kg.s-2

name: joule per kilogram
description: SI derived unit of specific energy or specific potential enthalpy, SI base unit equivalent: m2.kg.s-2.kg-1

name: watt per metre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of spectral intensity, SI base unit equivalent: m2.kg.s-2.m-1

name: watt per square metre
description: SI derived unit of heat flux density, irradiance, SI base unit equivalent: kg.s-3

name: watt per square metre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of radiance, SI base unit equivalent: m2.kg.s-3.m-2

name: watt per square metre per steradian per inverse centimetre
description: SI derived unit of spectral radiance per wave number, wave number expressed in 100 m-1, SI base unit equivalent: 0.01 m.kg.s-3

name: watt per square metre per steradian per inverse metre
description: SI derived unit of spectral radiance per wave number, SI base unit equivalent: mkg.s-3

name: watt per cubic metre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of spectral radiance, SI base unit equivalent: 100 m-1.kg.s-3

name: siemens per metre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of electric conductance, SI base unit equivalent: m-3.kg-1.s3.A2

name: square degree (angle)
description: Unit of square of phase or plane angle, accepted for use with SI

name: becquerel second per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of time integrated radioactivity concentration, SI base unit equivalent: m-3

name: decibel per metre
description: Unit of spatial gradient of sound intensity

name: decibel per degree (angle)
description: Unit of angular gradient of sound intensity

name: pH unit
description: Negative decimal logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity ('effective' concentration) specified in moles per litre

name: N unit
description: Unit of atmospheric refractivity, the refractivity, N, is related to the refractive index, n, by the formula N = 106 (n-1). N is therefore dimensionless but values computed by the formula are by convention described as being in 'N units'. (WMO Manual on Codes I.2)

name: unknown
description: The correct value is not known to, and not computable by, the sender of this data. However, a correct value probably exists.

name: kilohertz
description: SI derived unit of frequency, SI base unit equivalent: 1000 s-1

name: megahertz
description: SI derived unit of frequency, SI base unit equivalent: 1E6 s-1

name: gigahertz
description: SI derived unit of frequency, SI base unit equivalent: 1E9 s-1

name: terahertz
description: SI derived unit of frequency, SI base unit equivalent: 1E12 s-1

name: micromole per mole
description: SI derived unit equivalent to expressing mole fraction in ppm, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6

name: nanomole per mole
description: SI derived unit equivalent to expressing mole fraction in ppb, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-9

name: picomole per mole
description: SI derived unit equivalent to expressing mole fraction in ppt, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-12

name: millimole per mole
description: SI derived unit equivalent to expressing mole fraction in parts per thousand, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001

name: millibecquerel per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of volumetric radioactivity concentration, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 s-1.m-3

name: micromole per kilogram
description: SI derived unit of molar mass concentration, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 mol.kg-1

name: micromole per litre
description: SI derived unit of molar volumetric concentration, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 mol.m-3

name: nanogram per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of mass concentration, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-12 kg.m-3

name: dimensionless
description: Dimensionless

name: radian per second
description: SI derived unit of angular velocity, SI base unit equivalent: s-1

name: milligal
description: CGS unit of acceleration, equal to one thousandth of a Gal (1 Gal = 0.01 m s-2)

name: Eötvös
description: Unit of acceleration divided by distance, 1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km

name: (metric) ton per hectare
description: Unit of area density, equal to 0.1 kg.m-2

name: practical salinity unit
description: Close to 1, determined by CTD

name: nanometre
description: SI derived unit of length, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-9 m

name: parts per million by volume
description: Unit of volume fraction, equivalent to SI derived unit: 1E-6

name: parts per billion by volume
description: Unit of volume fraction, equivalent to SI derived unit: 1E-9

name: parts per trillion by volume
description: Unit of volume fraction, equivalent to SI derived unit: 1E-12

name: per kilometre
description: SI derived unit of quantity with dimension of reciprocal length, e.g., optical attenuation coefficients, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m-1

name: per megametre
description: Unit of quantity with dimension of reciprocal length, e.g., optical attenuation coefficients, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 m-1

name: missing
description: The correct value is not readily available to the sender of this data. Furthermore, a correct value may not exist

name: inapplicable
description: There is no value (categorical data).

description: SI derived unit for mass mixing ratio, equivalent to pptm or ppt, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-12

description: SI derived unit of specific volume, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 m-3

name: per cubic metre
description: SI derived unit of specific volume

description: SI derived unit of length, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 m

description: SI derived unit of mass concentration, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 kg.m-3

name: square centimetre
description: Unit of area, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-4 m2

name: Hazen unit
description: Unit of color according to the Platinum/Cobalt or Apha/Hazen scale

name: microsiemens per centimetre
description: SI derived unit of spatial gradient of electrical conductance, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-4 m-3.kg-1.s3.A2

name: gram per cubic centimetre
description: SI derived unit of density, equivalent to kilograms per litre, SI base unit equivalent: 1000 kg.m-3

name: millivolt
description: SI derived unit of voltage, electrical potential difference, electromotive force, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m2.kg.s-3.A-1

name: millibar
description: Unit of pressure, equal to one thousandth of a bar (0.001 bar), accepted for use with the SI

name: millimetre of mercury
description: Conventional unit of pressure, equal to 133.322387415 Pa

name: kilocalory per square centimetre
description: Unit of radiant exposure, equal to 4.184E7 J.m-2

name: nephelometric turbidity unit
description: Units of turbidity from a calibrated nephelometer

name: most probable number index number in 1 millilitre
description: Unit of expected number concentration of bacteria in the original sample based upon the statistical probability of the coincidence of microorganisms in each sample replicate

name: colony-forming unit per millilitre
description: Unit of number concentration of viable bacteria or fungal cells in a sample as a result of a plate count test

name: per kilometre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of the scattering coefficient at a given direction, SI base unit equivalent: 0.001 m-1

name: per metre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of the scattering coefficient at a given direction

name: per megametre per steradian
description: SI derived unit of the scattering coefficient at a given direction, SI base unit equivalent: 1E-6 m-1

name: metre per year
